stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

preGame:
LADIES, GENTLEMEN, AND HORRORS OF THE DEEP! Welcome to another bone-crushing edition of Tuesday Night Trollball! üéôÔ∏èüëπ I‚Äôm your host, Nok the Corrupter, broadcasting live from the windswept, salt-sprayed purgatory known as The Cliffside Pitch in Southport! The gale-force winds are howling, the sea is raging, and the smell of ozone and impending violence is thick in the air! üåäüí®

Tonight, we have a delightfully chaotic matchup! Visiting us from the rebellious districts, it's The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures! They are representing the White Ravens faction, folks. You know, Dame Terra Monteforte? The dirt wizard who thinks kidnapping prophets is a hobby? Let's hope her team can dig themselves out of trouble today! I heard a rumor that their star, Fogel Raynold, prepares for the match by slapping his own helmet until his ears ring. Now THAT is the kind of pre-game brain damage I look for in a champion! ü§™üî®

Defending the lighthouse, we have the home team, The Southport Narwhals! These warriors hail from the frigid grip of Grimfrost. King Nezmear might be busy up north breeding werewolves, but his team is here to freeze the competition in their tracks! I had a peek at the sidelines and saw Loralyn Lyndy theatrically adjusting their codpiece. Very important, folks! You don't want to take a mace to the unmentionables in this weather! ‚ùÑÔ∏èüõ°Ô∏è

But the most important statistic of the night isn't strength or agility... it's LIVER CAPACITY! üçªüç∑ That‚Äôs right, you thirsty violence-lovers, tonight is an OPEN BAR MATCH! Every time that Trollball hits the net, the taps open wide and the spirits flow! By the fourth quarter, we won't just be fighting the opposing team, we'll be fighting gravity itself! So raise your tankards, batten down the hatches, and let's play some TROLLBALL! üèàüî•
postGame:
BY THE GREAT PIT, WHAT A NIGHT! üèüÔ∏èüíÄ The wind was howling, the ale was flowing, and the bodies were hitting the floor faster than a clumsy goblin in a grease trap! The final whistle has blown at The Cliffside Pitch, and the home team, The Southport Narwhals, have harpooned a victory, shutting out The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures 2 to 0! üßú‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüèÜ

The game started with absolute savagery in the first half! Raouf Dragone of the Chaos Creatures apparently had a personal vendetta against Fineman Dolhenty, because he flattened the poor Narwhal not once, but TWICE in the opening minutes! I haven't seen a beating that one-sided since Sir Tanos caught me reading his diary! ü§ïüí• But you have to give it up for Sand Denys, the Narwhals' Healer. She was working overtime, scraping Fineman off the rocks and tossing them back into the fray like a ragdoll!

The injuries just kept piling up! Fogel Raynold decided that tackling wasn't enough and absolutely crushed Crescint Sonia, sending them to the sidelines! Then Boulanger Procto got in on the fun, taking out Loralyn Lyndy with a hit that I felt in my own non-existent soul! It was a beautiful display of the 'violence first, ball second' strategy that I adore! ü©∏üöë

The Chaos Creatures weren't done! Tucker Hett nearly decapitated Blanc Fantasia, and Urata Oriana laid out Torey Dannye with the force of a falling anvil! And let's not forget Gabriele Klehm, who sent Cibis Areta to the dirt! The first half wasn't a game; it was a triage unit with a scoreboard! The White Ravens usually like their curses subtle, but this team hits like a brick wrapped in a curse! üß±

After a Halftime break where I assume the Healers were paid double, we came back for more! But the violence didn't stop! Wolbrom Ariella immediately welcomed Fineman Dolhenty back to the field by INJURING THEM AGAIN! Fineman, if you're listening from the infirmary, maybe consider a career in librarianship? üìöüè•

Then, the magic happened! Malcolm Goer‚Äîwho I swear gains power by rubbing the ball in his armpits‚Äîbroke through the chaos! He sprinted down the field and DUNKED THE BALL! GOAL SOUTHPORT! üö®üèà And you know what that means! The kegs were breached! Immense amounts of alcohol were consumed instantly! I saw Crescint Sonia trying to look sober, but let's be honest, everyone was swaying like a ship in a storm!

The booze hit the players hard, but the Narwhals kept swimming! Fineman Dolhenty, proving that he's made of rubber and spite, managed to INTERCEPT a wild, drunken pass from Mouldon Earl! That‚Äôs redemption, folks! From the stretcher to the highlight reel! üéûÔ∏è‚ú®

With the momentum firmly in their favor, Blanc Fantasia wove through the stumbling defense‚Äîwho were probably seeing three balls by this point‚Äîand SLAMMED in the second goal! üçªüçª 2-0! The crowd went wild, the drinks poured, and I saw Cibis Areta looking visibly tipsy on the field. Urata Oriana looked like they were ready to fight a lighthouse!

The Chaos Creatures tried to rally, but coordination is hard when the ground is spinning. Mouldon Earl attempted a shot from Center Field, but I think the alcohol tolerance stats were the real MVP there, because that ball went wide! A tipsy disaster! üèπü•¥

And so, the Southport Narwhals take the win! A shutout victory for Grimfrost! King Nezmear can celebrate with his wolves tonight! As for the Chaos Creatures and the White Ravens... well, maybe Colm can give them a comforting, cursed handshake on the way out. This has been Nok the Corrupter, reminding you to drink responsibly, hit recklessly, and DON'T GET CAPTURED! üëπüìª
